result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Net Proceeds in an SEO** Orion AutoTech executed a seasoned equity offering (SEO) of 15 million shares at $37.94 per share. Of these, 6.1 million were primary (new shares issued by the company) and 8.9 million were secondary (sold by existing investors). Assume the underwriter charges 5.5% of the gross proceeds as an underwriting fee which is shared proportionately between the primary and secondary shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. The amount of money raised by the company (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to issuer = (Primary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on primary = (6.1 × $37.94) − (5.5% × $231.43 million) = $231.43 million − $12.73 million = **$218.7 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. The amount of money raised by the VC (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to VCs = (Secondary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on secondary = (8.9 × $37.94) − (5.5% × $337.67 million) = $337.67 million − $18.57 million = **$319.1 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
3. The amount of money the underwriter will earn (in million USD) is:
✅ Fee = (Total Shares × Price) × Fee Rate = (15 × $37.94) × 5.5% = $569.1 million × 5.5% = **$31.3 million**.
::: :::
